name: datadog-siem-cloud
label: Datadog Cloud SIEM
description: Datadog Cloud SIEM is a real time threat detection platform paired with rich observability context to achieve faster security outcomes.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: Specify the server URL to connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Specify the server URL to connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.name: api_key
fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.name: application_key
fields.title: Application Key
fields.description: Specify the Application key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations. Following are the minimum key scopes required: incident_read incident_write events_read hosts_read
fields.tooltip: Specify the Application key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations. Following are the minimum key scopes required: incident_read incident_write events_read hosts_read

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is selected, i.e., set to True.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified.

operations.title: Get Incidents
operations.description: Retrieves a detailed list of incidents based on the object types to include and pagination parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Include
parameters.name: include
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the types of related objects to include in the response. You can choose from the following options: Users, Attachments.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the types of related objects to include in the response. You can choose from the following options: Users, Attachments.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: page_offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records from Datadog Cloud SIEM.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records from Datadog Cloud SIEM.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records to retrieve, per page.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records to retrieve, per page.

operations.title: Get Incident Details
operations.description: Retrieves an incident's details based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to fetch its details.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the incident ID to fetch its details.

operations.title: Search Incidents
operations.description: Search and retrieve the detailed list of incidents based on the time range, incident state, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Start Datetime
parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.

parameters.title: End Datetime
parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.

parameters.title: State
parameters.name: state
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the state of the incident to filter the results. You can choose from the following options: Active, Stable, Resolved.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the state of the incident to filter the results. You can choose from the following options: Active, Stable, Resolved.

parameters.title: Severity
parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the severity of the incident to filter the results. You can choose from the following options: SEV-1 (Critical), SEV-2 (High), SEV-3 (Moderate), SEV-4 (Low), SEV-5 (Minor), Unknown.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the severity of the incident to filter the results. You can choose from the following options: SEV-1 (Critical), SEV-2 (High), SEV-3 (Moderate), SEV-4 (Low), SEV-5 (Minor), Unknown.

parameters.title: Customer Impacted
parameters.name: customer_impacted
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the checkbox to retrieve incidents that caused customer impact.
parameters.tooltip: Select the checkbox to retrieve incidents that caused customer impact.

parameters.title: Detection Method
parameters.name: detection_method
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the method used to detect the incident. You can choose from the following options: Customer, Employee, Monitor, Other, Unknown.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the method used to detect the incident. You can choose from the following options: Customer, Employee, Monitor, Other, Unknown.

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting criteria to sort the retrieved results. You can choose from the following options: Ascending, Descending.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sorting criteria to sort the retrieved results. You can choose from the following options: Ascending, Descending.

parameters.title: Include
parameters.name: include
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the types of related objects to include in the response. You can choose from the following options: Users, Attachments.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the types of related objects to include in the response. You can choose from the following options: Users, Attachments.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records from Datadog Cloud SIEM.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records from Datadog Cloud SIEM.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records to retrieve, per page.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records to retrieve, per page.

parameters.title: Fetch All Incidents
parameters.name: fetch_all_incidents
parameters.description: (Optional) Select to fetch all incidents.
parameters.tooltip: Select to fetch all incidents.

operations.title: Update Incident
operations.description: Updates an incident based on the incident ID, details to update and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident to update it on Datadog Cloud SIEM.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident to update it on Datadog Cloud SIEM.

parameters.title: Customer Impact End Date
parameters.name: customer_impact_end
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the datetime when customers were no longer impacted by the incident.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the datetime when customers were no longer impacted by the incident.

parameters.title: Customer Impact Scope
parameters.name: customer_impact_scope
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the summary of the impact customers experienced during the incident.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the summary of the impact customers experienced during the incident.

parameters.title: Customer Impact Start Date
parameters.name: customer_impact_start
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the datetime when customers began being impacted by the incident.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the datetime when customers began being impacted by the incident.

parameters.title: Customer Impacted
parameters.name: customer_impacted
parameters.description: (Optional) Select if the incident caused customer impact. You can choose from following options: True: Select if the incident impacted any customers. False: Select if the incident did not impact any customer.
parameters.tooltip: Select if the incident caused customer impact. You can choose from following options: True: Select if the incident impacted any customers. False: Select if the incident did not impact any customer.

parameters.title: Detected Date
parameters.name: detected
parameters.description: Select the date and time when the incident was detected to update the incident on the Datadog Cloud SIEM server.
parameters.tooltip: Select the date and time when the incident was detected to update the incident on the Datadog Cloud SIEM server.

parameters.title: State
parameters.name: state
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the state of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM. You can choose from the following options: Active Stable Resolved
parameters.tooltip: Select the state of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM. You can choose from the following options: Active Stable Resolved

parameters.title: Severity
parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the severity of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM. You can choose from the following options: SEV-1 (Critical) SEV-2 (High) SEV-3 (Moderate) SEV-4 (Low) SEV-5 (Minor) Unknown
parameters.tooltip: Select the severity of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM. You can choose from the following options: SEV-1 (Critical) SEV-2 (High) SEV-3 (Moderate) SEV-4 (Low) SEV-5 (Minor) Unknown

parameters.title: Detection Method
parameters.name: detection_method
parameters.description: (Optional) Select how the incident was detected to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM. You can choose from the following options: Customer Employee Monitor Other Unknown
parameters.tooltip: Select how the incident was detected to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM. You can choose from the following options: Customer Employee Monitor Other Unknown

parameters.title: Root Cause
parameters.name: root_cause
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a description of the root cause, triggers, and contributing factors of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a description of the root cause, triggers, and contributing factors of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM.

parameters.title: Title
parameters.name: title
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the title of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the title of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM.

parameters.title: Summary
parameters.name: summary
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a summary of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a summary of the incident to update on Datadog Cloud SIEM.

operations.title: Search Events
operations.description: Search and retrieve a detailed list of events based on the time range, filter query and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Start Datetime
parameters.name: from
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve events.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve events.

parameters.title: End Datetime
parameters.name: to
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve events.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve events.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the event search query to filter the retrieved events.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the event search query to filter the retrieved events.

parameters.title: Time Difference
parameters.name: time_difference
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the method of specifying the time difference. You can choose from the following options: Time Offset: Specify the time offset, in seconds, to apply to the query while searching for events. Timezone: Specify the timezone. The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York, or Asia/Kolkata).
parameters.tooltip: Select the method of specifying the time difference. You can choose from the following options: Time Offset: Specify the time offset, in seconds, to apply to the query while searching for events. Timezone: Specify the timezone. The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York, or Asia/Kolkata).

Timezone.title: Timezone
Timezone.name: timezone
Timezone.tooltip: Specify the timezone. The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York or Asia/Kolkata).
Timezone.description: Specify the timezone. The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York or Asia/Kolkata).

Time Offset.title: Time Offset
Time Offset.name: time_offset
Time Offset.tooltip: Specify the time offset, in seconds, to apply to the query while searching for events.
Time Offset.description: Specify the time offset, in seconds, to apply to the query while searching for events.

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Select an order to sort the events as per the created time. You can choose from the following options: Ascending Descending
parameters.tooltip: Select an order to sort the events as per the created time. You can choose from the following options: Ascending Descending

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the returned paging point to use to get the next results.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the returned paging point to use to get the next results.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of records to fetch, per page.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch, per page.

operations.title: Get Event Details
operations.description: Retrieves an event's details based on the event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Specify the event ID for which to fetch the details.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the event ID for which to fetch the details.

operations.title: Get Hosts
operations.description: Retrieves a detailed list of hosts for your organization based on the filter criteria, sorting order, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter query to search the results. For example: env:ci. To know more about the filter query refer to https://docs.datadoghq.com/metrics/advanced-filtering/.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter query to search the results. For example: env:ci. To know more about the filter query refer to https://docs.datadoghq.com/metrics/advanced-filtering/.

parameters.title: Sort Field
parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a field name to sort the hosts as per this criteria.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a field name to sort the hosts as per this criteria.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: sort_dir
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting order. You can choose from the following options: Ascending Descending
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sorting order. You can choose from the following options: Ascending Descending

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving the records.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving the records.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should fetch per page. Maximum supported value is 1000.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should fetch per page. Maximum supported value is 1000.

parameters.title: Start Datetime
parameters.name: _from
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date of time range within which to retrieve the records.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date of time range within which to retrieve the records.

parameters.title: Include Muted Hosts Data
parameters.name: include_muted_hosts_data
parameters.description: (Optional) Select to include muted hosts in the list of retrieved hosts.
parameters.tooltip: Select to include muted hosts in the list of retrieved hosts.

parameters.title: Include Hosts Metadata
parameters.name: include_hosts_metadata
parameters.description: (Optional) Select to include additional metadata about the hosts like agent_version, machine, platform, apps, or processor.
parameters.tooltip: Select to include additional metadata about the hosts like agent_version, machine, platform, apps, or processor.

operations.title: Get Attachments
operations.description: Retrieves a detailed list of attachments based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to fetch the associated attachments.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the incident ID to fetch the associated attachments.
